metadata.synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died. Wyll is not present.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard;- Go to 33; 35; -41 without Wyll

63.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
50.text: The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.NodeContext: Include Florrick Spitting before saying line.

46.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
46.text: You are either a fool for trusting him - or a wretch for conspiring with him. It doesn't matter which.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

73.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
73.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How Wyll slaughtered his own father, how he craves his power.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

16.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
16.text: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

26.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
26.text: This city holds no place for you - or for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

62.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

75.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

74.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
1.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
4.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

79.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
79.text: There's something you must know. I should've told Wyll sooner, but I'd hoped somehow Ravengard would return to us.

64.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
64.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
78.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
29.text: Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I should seek Wyll out and give him a message.

44.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
44.text: Wyll was schooled in the ways of the great champions. He is to use those lessons to wake the wyrm sleeping beneath Baldur's Gate. The wyrm is oathbound to answer the call and come to the city's aid.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

49.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
49.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Do you know what these lessons are?

19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
19.text: No. But I know only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. I thought only Ulder could succeed. With his death, the duty falls to his son.

8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
8.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
10.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened - but just the once.

55.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
55.text: The city has faced countless threats. But Ravengard knew it could not survive the Absolute's slaughter.

18.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
18.text: With him gone and the city near ruin, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you and Wyll.

20.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
20.text: The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

31.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
31.text: Let it set the path before you. Or do not, and see Baldur's Gate burn to ash.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
30.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
45.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

38.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
38.text: Have courage. May we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
69.text: Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Your faith is well-founded. I will take your message to Wyll.

23.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
23.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
7.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
17.text: I should go. I know of still others that might help us when the battle horns call.

2.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
2.text: Unleash the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. And may they be driven forever from the Coast.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

58.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
58.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

56.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
56.text: That warrior was Ravengard. If you prize his ways, you'll help Wyll seek out the wyrm.

76.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
76.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

9.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
9.text: I once carried it, but it was stolen from me. Find it, let it set the path before you. Or do not, and see your home burn to ash.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.

28.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
28.text: Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please - take him this message.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

68.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
68.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

42.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
13.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

61.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
61.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

34.speaker: Player
34.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

32.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
32.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
3.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

51.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

41.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
41.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

47.speaker: Player
47.text: When we found you in prison, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?

77.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
77.text: Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered Ulder like the devils you are.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.

53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
53.text: Then your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!
